page.title: 05Depopulation of Pontycymer
page.content: From 1925 onwards the population decreased, and until the early 1970's many houses in Pontycymer remained derelict. However in the last decade, the population has slightly increased and few houses are now empty. This is because Pontycymer, now becoming devoid of some of the ugliness of industry, is returning to an area of natural beauty and has become residential area. Good communications and especially the building of the M4 mean that workers can easily commute to Bridgend Cardiff and other areas. This return of people to an area they once were glad to leave is interesting . Not long ago few people would have ever dreamed of such an industrial area becoming mainly residential. Land values are still low; what happens to them in the future is yet to be seen.
